item.title: A Field Guide to Lies & Stats (Levitin 2016)
item.description: Evaluating Numbers Plausibility Averages Axes Reporting How numbers are collected Probabilities Evaluating Words Identifying expertise Induction vs deduction Evaluating Numbers Plausibility Numerical sense checks. Claim: “In the 35 years since marijuana laws stopped being enforced in California, the number of marijuana smokers has doubled every year”. Even if we start with the most generous estimate that intitially there was 1 marijuana smoker then after 35 years that would give us \(2^{34} (> 17\text{bil})\) smokers.
